title: How Japan’s powerful earthquakes have shifted the land
description: The country has shifted more than a metre to the west following the earthquake this week.
content:
The power of the magnitude 7.5 quake in Japan can be seen in just how much the ground moved. 
It rose up by more than 4m (13ft) in places and moved sideways by over a metre.

description: Relatively low death toll a testament to country's preparedness, say experts
content:

title: Japan earthquake: How can buildings be more resilient?
description: When earthquakes occur, the resulting building collapses, no the tremors themselves, are what lead to high death tolls. How should buildings be constructed to prevent deaths and injuries?
content:
The primary cause of death in an earthquake is not the shaking ground but crumbling roofs, crashing walls and collapsing buildings.
